intro: Symplocos pallida, commonly known as white alder or white symplocos, is a deciduous shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are elliptical in shape and often have a waxy coating. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in forest understories. Symplocos pallida plays a role in supporting local wildlife, including insects and birds.
